main event: On 13th March 1955 in Burbank, California, a civilian observer witnessed an orange and red object heading southeast across the sky and disappearing within three seconds. The observer used binoculars to view the object.
interesting points: The observation lasted only three seconds, making further investigation impractical.
The object was described as very large and was heading southeast before disappearing.
The observer used binoculars to view the object, indicating a serious attempt to identify it.
The possibility of the sighting being astronomical in nature, specifically a meteorite, was considered valid due to the brief duration and nature of the sighting.
No investigation was authorized by the command due to the brevity of the sighting and the improbability of obtaining significant data.
sighted object: One orange and red object in the sky
